explanation: The stage direction describes the setting of the scene, including the name of the ship, the time of day, the weather conditions, the temperature, and the date. It also mentions when the ship will depart, which further provides context for the scene's setting.
stgdir: Sur le navire nommé Le Saint-Jean de la Rochelle, au petit matin, avec du brouillard. Il fait frais, le 14 juillet 1650. Le Saint-Jean repartira le 23 août.
